headline: Soft Sugar Cookies
description: This soft sugar cookie recipe is quick and easy to make. Use any color sugar to make these for holidays, birthdays, or other special occasions.

video.description: These addictive cookies are soft and just right for decorating.
video.name: Soft Sugar Cookies IV

name: Soft Sugar Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place decorating sugar in a small bowl (or use several colors and separate bowls).

Beat shortening and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer until smooth and creamy, 2 to 3 minutes. Mix in sugar until incorporated, then mix in eggs, one at a time, scraping the sides of the bowl as necessary. Mix in vanilla.
Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl until combined. Gradually add to the wet ingredients and mix until incorporated and the dough comes together.
Roll dough into walnut-sized balls. Roll each ball in sugar to coat, then place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until light brown on the bottoms, 10 to 12 minutes, switching racks halfway through. Remove from the oven and transfer to wire racks to cool.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic! I used very little salt, maybe a half teaspoon at most since I used salted butter. I rolled the dough balls (snicker doodles style) in raw sugar to give it a pleasant crunch shell to the super soft innards. I did add in colored sugar with the raw to give it a festive Christmas look this time around.
These were ok but a little too crunchy. Thought they’d be thicker and chewy.
the sugar cookies were great they were super soft and i love sugar cookies they are great thx. and i sorta made them my way.

What state gave these cookies a blue ribbon? They are cakey not soft. I have been baking for 50 years . I am careful in measuring and precise. I made no substitutions. My favorite sugar cookie comes crisp edges and soft chewy centers but I wanted to find one that was all-over soft. Too much like a biscuit according to my grandson. Still searching. ( I think there is too much flour in recipe by at least 1/4 cup, maybe more and yes I spooned and leveled )
This recipe was great, but I added a little milk and almond extract. I also lowered the oven to 325. The cookies came out perfect and soft!
really good cookies. everyone liked them

I love the consistency of this cookie. they stood shape so well and stay nice and soft. simple and easy cookie that got many great compliments from co-workers. the trick is to use a good vanilla. I also made this same recipe adding the vanilla along with a smidge of lemon extract and grated nutmeg. There is a lot of versatility in this recipe but the fact that the cookie consistency itself is so nice makes it a standard recipe to keep in your file to be able to add whatever extract or spices you want while keeping the basic baking chemistry the same. thank you for this recipe. a keeper for me
Great recipe - outsides are a little crunchy and the insides are soft and chewy - exquisite recipe!

Made this and handed out to family & friends and they have all requested more!!! I didn't change anything as they were AWESOME!!
Made 2 batches in 1 day. I rolled out about 3/4 tsp each and came out with 72 cookies. I would highly recommend making these. I use regular sugar and colored with liquid food coloring for topping. Only laid sugar out on freezer paper after coloring....I did not put in oven. Worked out fine. LOVE THESE COOKIES!!! baked for 8-10 mins instead of 10-12.
Definitely save this recipe. Just added couple tablespoons light brown sugar. Perfect soft sugar cookies!!!
I made these 3 times this week! They were such a hit.
This is my go-to. The only addition I use is 1t almond extract. Rave reviews!
This recipes was absolute perfection and so easy. There is no need to ever try another recipe.

This recipe is a favorite at our house. Using a gluten free 1-1 flour it easily converts to an awesome gluten free cookie. For me, the gluten free version spreads well on its own, but I have to slightly flatten the regular cookies with a cup. The final result does turn out a little salty, so I will try reducing the salt a bit. But they are gone in a flash at our house.
This is not a good recipe if you want to roll it out.
They were soft but not the best

This is exactly the recipe I was looking for! I wanted a soft sugar cookie that didn’t need to be rolled; I have a traditional recipe for cutouts. It’s the taste I was hoping to find, it must be the baking powder. Perfect with the tops of the balls dipped in nonpareils and flattened lightly with a glass.

This cookie is incredibly salty. It is also not very sweet. Probably will be good with icing. Next time, I will make it with half the salt, all butter instead of shortening and add icing or buttercream to it.

I rolled the dough out and cut it with cookie cutters for Christmas cookies. I had no trouble at all working with the dough, and the cookies came out nice and soft as promised, with just the right level of sweetness.

I only make sugar cookies once in a blue moon, and now that I have a young child we made these for Christmas! The recipe is tasty and the cookies are soft. We rolled out and cut them into shapes and it worked great.
They didn’t spread for me. Followed to the T.
I’ve used this recipe to make Baby Yoda cookies multiple times now. Chilling the dough after rolling it into sheets makes it much easier to work with when using cookie cutters.

I used the dough portion of this recipe to make thumbprint jam cookies. They turned out fantastic! 

I've tried many versions of jam cookie recipes and these, strangely, these sugar cookies turned out to be the favorite.

Used Big Jalm varieties for the jam.

Loved it and so does everyone else. I’m about as far from a good baker, cook or chef as it gets. Usually takes multiple times to get a recipe of anything right. These turned out great first time! After making the dough I put it in the fridge for 30 minutes then rolled it out and used cookie cutters for Xmas cookies. Rolled out about 1/4” thick and they get thicker while baking but don’t spread out so you can position lots on the pan. I’ve already written this one down on paper for a permanent keeper. Thank you.

Great recipe!! Followed the steps exactly as stated. Baked them for 10 minutes. Used it for decorating the cookies for Santa with the grandkids. Received a lot of compliments!! This is a keeper. Thanks for sharing.
They are super easy to make & taste so good. Always comes out soft.
I substituted eggs for ground flax and water and they turned out scrumptious! Instead of topping with sugar I iced them.
Great recipe. I chose this after I realized I had not made a frosted sugar cookie since I was a teen. These are definitely a winner! Bonus very easy recipe to make a half batch.
Best roll out that I’ve ever made. Wasn’t sticky and cut so good!

These cookies are AMAZING! If heaven could be in cookies, it would be in these! I tried it at first with brown sugar to substitute the white sugar, and it was a very bad decision. The cookies were bland and tasted highly of plain bread. But with white sugar its AMAZING!

I enjoyed making this recipe, and think it worked well. However, i feel the instructions were a bit unclear; the recipe calls for just “white sugar” and it later calls for granulated sugar so I wasn’t sure what kind of sugar to use. I ended up using granulated, and that worked just fine. Will be using this recipe again. Thank you.
Fantastic!! I followed the recipe and they came out wonderful. 5 stars plus

Complete waste of ingredients! Cookies still look like balls of dough and they tasted awful! I cannot believe this recipe got such good reviews. I followed the recipe exactly and couldn't be more disappointed wish I could give it 0 stars

I've finally found a 'go-to' sugar cookie recipe. I love the crisp exterior on a soft cookie. I added a bit of orange extract to the dough. I weighed my balls before dipping in the sugar and flattening to 1/4 with the bottom of a glass. This gave me a uniform size. These cookies are wonderful as is, or frosted and decorated.

I made this with such high hopes cause of the reviews. But nope. Kind of upset. The cookies do not spread! I wish i had read the reviews before making them. I went to check on them after 9 mins and they were still in little balls!!!!! so i had to press them down and ugh! Also too much salt. The taste is just okay.
They were great!
Perfect

Ok so I’m not a baker by any means but because of Covid I’m not able to do my usual volunteer work. So I signed up to bake cookies to send to our soldiers abroad. This recipe makes me look I’ve been baking for years. The only thing I had to change was swapping all butter for shortening as recommended by the organization to keep the cookie from going rancid before reaching destination. I used butter flavor crisco and added 4 tsp of water to account for the conversion. The batter was ridiculously easy to work with after mixing so I decided not to refrigerate as I originally planned. I dipped in Halloween colored sprinkles and baked. The cookies turned out awesome! Buttery and chewy with the right amount of sweetness! We almost ate them all and I had to make a second batch so I would have enough to ship!! This recipe is great and I’ll be using this as my “go to” cookie batter for sure! Thanks for sharing!!!!
So easy to make and delicious! Fun baking activity with my 3 year old :)
It’s a hit in my household!

I love these cookies. They come together fast and are soft. I made they exactly as written the first time. I understand what people were saying about the salt. I liked it, but my family did not. The second time I made them I mixed the salt in with the eggs before blending the eggs into the batter. The cookies were just as good but without the salty taste. Solved!
So easy to make, and came out soft!
They came out perfectly and delicious. Also, did not last a day in my house.
Love how these taste! We

The cookies are good but they burned anytime I put them on a regular cookie tray. We have some trays that prevent burning, and they work very well on those. But, on regular trays, the bottoms burn quickly and the tops don't even feel fully cooked. Not sure why because my other cookies are fine on the regular trays. It was just these ones. Also, I thought the picture up top was what they would be. Definitely not, but that was my mistake.
used less butter but still good
Good & easy recipe. Toppings made them better. Cookie is light & not very flavorable by itself...
I loved making this recipe. I rolled the dough in cinnamon and sugar. Thanks for this recipe!
No was good
Felt like I needed to add additional flour because dough was too sticky for cookie cutters. Added approximately 1 additional cup. We’re tasty and perfect for decorating.
Very tasty. My recommendation is to push them down a lot or else they will not flatten and cook through. Otherwise a great recipe
Definitely added the orange zest...lemon would be great too (use zest of two lemons). Super recipe,

I made these a couple of months ago on Valentine’s Day for my boyfriend. Delicious! The only substitution I made to the later batches was to turn the heat up about 5-10 degrees and cut the baking time down to like 8 or so minutes before letting them cool and set for at least twenty more minutes. The result is a soft chewy cookie. Thanks for this recipe!
My whole family loves these cookies! Beautiful texture. I didn't need to add frosting...the kids love them!
Delicious!!

AWESOME recipe! It's a family favorite! I rated it a 4 because I had to go 1/2 cup less on the flour and use a whole stick of butter so it wouldn't be so chalky, otherwise I would've given this a full 5.
First time making sugar cookies from scratch. I used all butter. I also added s 1/2 tsp of almond to the vanilla. Delicious recipe. Seemed to me even better next day.

This is my sugar cookie recipe from now on. I used it for rolled out cookies and it works great and they stay soft forever! Okay, not like FOREVER but until they got eaten. Flavor is perfect, not too sweet, but sweet enough to be eaten without frosting if you want.

These are fantastic!! I made these and was in the mood for a lemon cookie so I used lemon extract rather than vanilla BUT I can tell by the texture and taste of the cookie that they would be phenomenal sugar cookies. They are soft and moist. The recipe didn’t specify the consistency of the butter. I used it straight from the fridge and my mixture didn’t form well for me, stayed crumbly, so I reached in a used my hands. Came out perfect.
These cookies are delicious! Followed the recipe with no changes. Thanks for sharing.
Love these cookies!
simply awful. the dough was tough and feel apart. the cookies were hard. simply awful. followed recipe and instructions exactly too

I tried to use this for cookie cutters, the dough was really soft and I struggled. However, I am newish to baking. A friend suggested putting the dough in the fridge for an hour then try again. It helped but was still not much better. If you are going to make these I would stick to the balls, per the recipe, unless you are a seasoned baker. They were not very sweet. You need to ice them for sure. I think if I had more experience under my belt it would have gone better.
Delicious & super easy. Family loved this recipe. Will be making these over and over.
Wonderful Cookies! They were the talk of our work potluck!
Excellent and simple sugar cookie recipe. We put the dough in the refrigerator overnight and rolled it out the next day for cutout cookies, worked great! Nice flavor and texture

Cookies themselves are delicious. Dough was not suitable for cutting cookies. The recipe did say to make drop cookies, but other reviews indicated it was good for rolling out. I had to make extra thick cookies (1/2") to get any decent cut outs.

I used all butter and half the salt. Rolled out the dough to use cookie cutters. Came out with good texture and softness. I’ll add some stuff next time to add more flavor, like almond or lemon extract, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Absolutely love these! They do puff up a bit but they are perfect !
I've made this recipe for years and absolutely love these. I make these for a quick go to recipe for kiddos as a surprise
My 10 year old soon and I made these. East receipt and the cookies turns out delicious and soft. We held two back for Santa and took the rest to highs class.
They were very good and easy. When I put tnem in the oven they didn't spreed out. But they were good. I will mae them again.
They were very good and easy. When I put tnem in the oven they didn't spreed out. But they were good. I will mae them again.

Cookies tasted more like a buttery shortbread cookie than a sugar cookie. I was also surprised that the cookies did not rise or expand so stayed in balls (which is not a big deal). The cookies were too buttery for me but I still ate a few and my 4 year old did not like them but finished one or two. The recipe makes over 50 cookies.
easy to make and stays soft for a long time (at least a week). husband loves them
The cookies ended up flat no matter how much I did to change this, and there seemed like there was a lot of salt. They tasted good, though.

This is the first time I've made cookies from scratch. They came out delicious. My husband thought they weren't sweet enough so we added 1/4 cup of sugar the 2nd time around. Either way they were delicious. I just had one out of the tupperware & it was still soft after a week. We used cookie cutters & we had to refrigerate the dough for a little while, maybe 45 minutes, and were able to roll it out & cut shapes. We iced them using the sugar cookie icing recipe. They were a hit.
Quick and easy! I used gluten free rice flour and they turned out great.

I actually like the flavor. Not my fav but good. I wont be making this recipe as I am trying to find recipe to be able to decorate but this recipe just stretches WAYY to much and doesn't keep the form of the cookie cutter so its a no for.

I wanted to make the cookies harder, so I extended the baking time on a baking stone from 12 to about 18 minutes, and the sugar cookies really firmed up nicely. Since the cookies don't flatten out too much as others had mentioned, I simply used my fingers to flatten the dough. The sugar helps keep the cookies from sticking.
We made cut out and regular "round cookies". Both turned out great. My mom tried one and wanted the recipe. #FamilyFavorite.

I did everything that the recipe called for and creamed my butter and shortning with the sugar but it turned out really dry. It was impossible to roll out and the cookie dough fell apart when we rolled them into balls. They didn't flaten in the baking prosess. I would up using a 1/4 of a cup oil to save all the work we put into the dough but I wouldn't make them again.
I can’t have gluten so I made the recipe with gluten free flour (King Arthur) and they turned out amazing. Couldn’t tell they where GF.
These were a hit!!
These cookies are soft and delicious. They’re perfect. I don’t change a thing.
Super Easy, I’m at 8400ft and have been adjusting my baking.....these where perfect, we topped them with a lemon zest buttercream frosting!! Enjoy!!
Excellent recipe, I have made these several times. After they are rolled in sugar, mash with a glass. Use different colors of sugar for different holidays.

I was going to make my grandmother’s homemade sugar cookies but I lost the recipe so I went online to see if I could find another one similar to it well I have to tell you I found it it was great my kids loved it and I think I’ll be making this one again
Followed the recipe exact and these cookies were the bomb! Only regret is I cannot stop eating them. Will definitely make again.

We made rolled cookies. I made the recipe just as written except I did not have plain vanilla. I used butter vanilla from Watkins. I also divided the dough into two pieces and wrapped it in plastic wrap and refrigerated for an hour before we rolled it out. The cookies were perfect at 11 minutes and they did not spread. My grandkids had a blast making and decorating these into Halloween cookies!!! I will make these again!!

Just wow! these are seriously the best sugar cookies that I have ever made! Super easy, roll them out and cut them, didn’t chill the dough. Came out soft, yet firm enough..just perfect cookies! I made larger cutouts so I had to cook for about 15 minutes. Looking forward to making this recipe during Christmas. I was running low on butter and had to substitute 1/3 cup of butter flavored Crisco. They turned out amazing I have zero complaints with my substitute. Will make again following recipe exactly.
These are delicious! Easy to make with kids.
So soft and they kept their shape!
Delicious!! Will definitely be making these again!

Amazing! The only thing I would change is smushing them down before I put them in the oven!
YUMMMMMMMMMM
my toddler and i made it! so much fun and yummy!!!

Great recipe! I loved how soft and chewy they are. The cookies have the perfect amount of sugar in them. They were super chewy but weren’t too breakable. If I would make these again I’d say to flatten the cookies before baking them because the dough doesn’t flatten itself very much.
yummy! took a little longer to cook for me like 12-14 min. also used all butter instead of shortening turned out awesome
Good recipe! I did reduce the amount of salt to 1/2 and I still think I could have reduced it to 1/4 since I use salted butter.
